title: The Voice: Grace Holden tells of opening up about her grief
description: Grace Holden found talking about her mum's death hard - until she opened up about it on The Voice.

title: Deaths climb as India reels from deadly Covid wave
description: Heart-wrenching images from crematoriums across the country capture the true toll of the virus.

title: Your pictures on the theme of 'fences'
description: A selection of striking images from our readers on this week's theme.

title: Screen time at 'breaking point' but can tech help?
description: There is growing evidence notifications and too much screen time can reduce attention and productivity.

title: How Armel Zola is helping people to 'stay positive' at home
description: The former footballer is teaching dancing in lockdown to young adults with Down's Syndrome.

title: Oscars 2021: 'I don't mind being the underdog'
description: Irish animation studio Cartoon Saloon's latest film Wolfwalkers is up for an Oscar on Sunday night.

title: Brazil: Environment police battle for Amazon rainforest
description: Riots, policy changes and funding cuts have all threatened the mission to preserve the rainforest.

title: Oscars 2021: Stars prepare for in-person ceremony
description: The 93rd Academy Awards take place on Sunday night, from multiple locations around the world.

title: Afghanistan War: How can the West fight terrorism after leaving?
description: As Western troops prepare to go, there are concerns over the future of counter-terrorism operations.

title: Match of the Day: Alan Shearer and Micah Richards 'flabbergasted' by Fabian Balbuena's red
description: Match of the Day trio Gary Lineker, Alan Shearer and Micah Richards describe Fabian Balbuena's red card during West Ham's defeat by Chelsea as "ridiculous" and "embarrassing".

title: European Super League: 'A seismic, pivotal week in football - but game not yet over'
description: BBC sports editor Dan Roan looks back at a 'seismic and pivotal' launch and crash of the European Super League, and what might happen next.

title: Social media boycott: Premier League clubs join four-day move to tackle abuse
description: Premier League, EFL and WSL clubs join in a four-day boycott of social media platforms in an effort to combat abuse and discrimination.

title: Q&A: Armenian genocide dispute
description: What was the Armenian "genocide" and why is it still such a sensitive issue?

title: US Dragon spaceship arrives at International Space Station
description: SpaceX's Dragon Endeavour spacecraft has docked with the International Space Station.

title: Dominic Cummings allegations: Boris Johnson urged to explain funding of flat refurbishment
description: It comes after Dominic Cummings claimed Boris Johnson had once had plans to get donors to fund the work.

title: 'What a beautiful strike' - Raul Jimenez's 'fantastic' volley against Burnley
description: Watch Raul Jimenez' "fantastic" goal for Wolverhampton Wanderers against Burnley in July 2020 ahead of their Premier League match this weekend live on the BBC.

title: Slieve Donard: 'Deeply distressing' scene as mountain blaze tackled
description: NI SoS Brandon Lewis joins calls for the public to stay away from the Mourne Mountains during major fire.

title: MLB: Fan takes catch ahead of Arizona Diamondbacks' Kole Calhoun
description: Watch the moment a 13-year-old fan, attending his first game, takes a catch in the stands, beating Arizona Diamondbacks' Kole Calhoun in the process.

title: Three-lorry M5 crash in Gloucestershire leaves driver dead
description: The fatal crash, on the M5 in Gloucestershire, closes the route between Thornbury and Stroud.

title: Indonesian submarine sank off Bali, navy says
description: A scan detected the vessel at a depth of 850m, well below the survivable limit, the navy says.

title: India Covid surge: Hospitals send SOS as record deaths registered
description: Patients are dying because of a lack of medical oxygen supplies, doctors warn.

title: Brazil cuts environment budget despite climate summit pledge
description: At a climate summit, President Bolsonaro had promised to boost spending and tackle deforestation.

title: Razzies: Singer Sia named worst director for controversial film Music
description: The pop star's directorial debut tops the infamous Razzies - the awards for the year's worst movies.

title: Boy stabbed to death in Newham, east London
description: The teenager was confirmed dead at the scene and officers are trying to find and tell his family.

title: 'I walked 5,000 miles to show people are not alone'
description: Fleming Keery, 69, talks to those he passes, wearing a coat signalling a suicide prevention helpline.

title: The Papers: Cummings' 'war' with PM and 'No masks by summer'
description: Saturday's front pages focus on former No 10 adviser Dominic Cummings' attack on the prime minister.

title: Covid-19: Israel records no daily deaths for the first time in 10 months
description: The drop in deaths is seen as a promising sign as Israel vaccinates more than 50% of its population.
